stories.headline: GIS data carries high cost
stories.summary: Journalists face high costs and restrictive laws when attempting to obtain GIS data from government agencies. Many argue these practices hinder public access to taxpayer-funded data.

stories.headline: Mapping finds bars, DUI wrecks linked
stories.summary: An investigation into drunken driving reveals a link between liquor licenses and alcohol-related accidents, showcasing the use of mapping tools in journalism.

stories.headline: Data boosts crime stories
stories.summary: With the aid of computer-assisted reporting, journalists can access vast amounts of crime data to develop impactful stories and investigate criminal justice issues.

stories.headline: Another member of the family moves on
stories.author_title: NICAR and Missouri School of Journalism
stories.summary: Aron Pilhofer, known for his work on campaign finance and open-source software, leaves IRE to join the Center for Public Integrity, contributing to open source software journalism.

stories.headline: CENSUS 2000 Covering income, commuting with SF3
stories.summary: The release of Census 2000 data opens new reporting opportunities, with journalists exploring demographic shifts using the detailed tables provided.
